image.altText: A woman is approached by an airport worker as she walks through the security area of the airport.

props.synopsis: A magistrate describes a woman's behaviour as "extremely bizarre" as he sentences her for evading security staff and running out onto the tarmac at Canberra Airport in 2023.

title.children: 'Extremely bizarre': Woman fined for running onto Canberra Airport tarmac

image.altText: A school sign on the exterior of a large modern building.

props.synopsis: Some Brindabella Christian College staff have not been paid their salaries on time, with the school's executive principal putting the blame on "timing challenges" related to the payment of school fees by parents.

title.children: 'I ask for your patience': Private school principal tells unpaid staff

image.altText: A military service Belgian shepherd sits on the grass in front of the Australian War Memorial.

props.synopsis: A Belgian shepherd who went from pound puppy to decorated combat veteran has been honoured with a new award for distinguished military service at the Australian War Memorial.

title.children: 'The $8 dog' wins prestigious award for military service

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann outside the ACT Supreme Court with a serious expression, wearing glasses and a tie. He has a beard.

props.synopsis: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann appears in a Tasmanian court via phone to face allegations he stole a car in the Huon Valley, south of Hobart.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann faces Hobart court on car theft charge

image.altText: Young man in bushland wearing a dark green shirt.

props.synopsis: For 13 days Hadi Nazari was lost in Kosciuszko National Park's unforgiving and untamed wilderness. This is his story of survival, told like never before.

title.children: 'Every negligence accumulated': Hadi Nazari on why he got lost in Kosciuszko

image.altText: Red poppies left at a sculpture

props.synopsis: A sculpture at the Australian War Memorial representing the impact of service-related trauma on veterans and their families is providing a place for grieving and commemoration one year since being officially dedicated.

title.children: 'I miss your smile': Letters and photos left at war memorial sculpture

image.altText: Orange cones circle space around a tree

props.synopsis: Four Year Six students were injured when a branch fell from a tree during a school excursion at Government House, with one taken to hospital in a critical condition.

title.children: Schoolgirl critically injured during visit to Government House in Canberra

image.altText: a man in a green shirt crosses his arms at a table

props.synopsis: Canberra is widely considered 'the most renter-friendly' city, but amid constant legislative changes in favour of tenants, that title may be coming at a cost to landlords, with investors leaving the ACT.

title.children: Investors leaving Australia's 'most renter-friendly' city

image.altText: damaged gravestones

props.synopsis: The 180-year-old Queanbeyan Riverside Cemetery is home to its fair share of ghost stories, urban myths and legends, but locals fear for its future due to a lack of maintenance and vandalism.

title.children: Historical cemetery known for floating coffins and ghost stories in grave danger

image.altText: A young man sits in a gym, with two prosthetic legs.

props.synopsis: Three years to the day since Vladimir Putin's forces began their full-scale invasion of the country, Ukrainians tell of their fears and hopes for the future.

title.children: Victor lost both his legs fighting for Ukraine. He doesn't want it to be in vain

image.altText: Richard White stands in front of office windows, with rooftops and trees visible behind him

props.synopsis: Shares in WiseTech Global have plunged on news four board directors, including the chair, have quit due to a dispute about the ongoing role of founder, billionaire Richard White.

title.children: WiseTech shares plunge as directors, chair quit over Richard White

image.altText: The logo of crypto exchange platform Bybit with bitcoins around it

props.synopsis: The Dubai-based platform Bybit said an attacker gained control of an Ethereum wallet and transferred its holdings to an unknown address.

title.children: Hackers steal $2.4bn from crypto exchange Bybit in 'largest heist' of all time

image.altText: A blue and white flag seen through the window of a helicopter, with a palm to the glass next to it

props.synopsis: The United States says it supports Israel for its decision to delay releasing 620 Palestinian prisoners, a key term agreed upon as part of the Gaza ceasefire deal.

title.children: US to support Israel 'whatever' way needed as Netanyahu delays prisoner release

image.altText: Photo of nuclear power station chimneys

props.synopsis: Additional emissions from adopting the Coalition's nuclear plan equate to 200 years of domestic air travel for Australia, a new analysis from the Climate Change Authority reveals.

title.children: Going nuclear to blow out Australia's carbon budget, modelling shows

image.altText: A blue, white and red 'bulk billing available' sign on a black fenceline

props.synopsis: Federal Labor and the Coalition both want to expand the bulk-billing incentive to all Australians, to make nine out of 10 GP visits free by the end of the decade.

title.children: Will a new bulk billing pledge mean you'll see your GP for free?

image.altText: Blurred numbers on the ASX stock boards

props.synopsis: Australian shares have regained some ground, after initially following Wall Street's lead lower as concerns mount about the US economy. WiseTech shares fall as turmoil continues as directors quit the board. Follow live.

title.children: ASX claws back after Wall Street's worst session of the year

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX battles back to end higher, WiseTech smashed
Former Star Entertainment executives fined for breaching duties
WiseTech denies withholding 'material' information from market

image.altText: Drone view of housing rooftops and roads

props.synopsis: An increase in government assistance, better relationships between tenants and landlords and bolstered housing stocks are just some of the solutions Australia's leading housing experts have offered to solve the country's rental crisis.

title.children: Australia's leading minds propose their solutions to the rental problem

image.altText: Ralph Fiennes, John Lithgow, Sergio Castellitto and Isabella Rossellini

props.synopsis: The drama beat Anora, A Complete Unknown and Wicked to take Best Ensemble at the Screen Actors Guild Awards.

title.children: SAG Awards: Papal drama Conclave takes top film win at 2025 ceremony

image.altText: A close up of a woman's hands holding a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Millions of dollars have been stolen from members of Victoria's Chinese-speaking community through a sophisticated extortion scam which police are warning is on the rise.

title.children: A fake Chinese authority scam is extorting millions from victims

image.altText: Home and Away star Lynne McGranger

props.synopsis: Home and Away has announced it will say goodbye to legacy character Irene Roberts, played by Lynne McGranger, after more than three decades on the show.

title.children: Home and Away star bows out after 33 years

image.altText: A profile photo of a man with apparent face art.

props.synopsis: A man accused of murdering his cellmate in an Adelaide prison has been declared mentally incompetent to commit the crime and found not guilty.

title.children: Man accused of cellmate murder found not guilty by reason of mental incompetence

image.altText: A young man in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: A young man was discharged from a Gold Coast hospital despite his mother warning he was suicidal. When he died days later, a review of his case fused anger to his mother's grief.

title.children: Mother says review of son's death blamed him

image.altText: A security guard stands with his back to the camera in front of an emergency department entrance

props.synopsis: Long waits in overcrowded emergency departments are leaving patients frustrated and exacerbating violence towards staff, according to the peak body for emergency medicine.

title.children: Doctors say violence in emergency departments a 'national crisis'

image.altText: The picture of two men wearing tradition Islamic headwear and robes shown on a screen in a stadium with a crowd surrounding it

props.synopsis: Hassan Nasrallah was killed in an Israeli air strike in September 2024, and Israel continued attacks on Lebanon in the hours ahead of his funeral despite a ceasefire deal in place.

title.children: Thousands mourn slain Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah in funeral

image.altText: A woman sits with a baby on her lap, her husband crouches down next to her patting a brown kelpie.

props.synopsis: The federal government's decision to abolish the childcare activity test and provide more guaranteed subsidised days for parents is unlikely to change anything for regional families, advocates say.

title.children: Childcare changes unlikely to help regional Australians, advocates say

image.altText: A red brick school building with manicured lawns and gardens.

props.synopsis: Ballarat Grammar School's principal alleges older students have been hitting their younger peers in "some sort of perverse sense of justice for perceived boarding house misdemeanours".

title.children: Boarders accused of 'horrendous' bullying at Victorian boys' school

image.altText: Woman in white dress holding photograph of a little boy and a little girl

props.synopsis: A mother from the West Australian town of Bunbury shares her horrific experience of losing a child, who unknowingly had a heart condition, in hope of helping others in grief.

title.children: After losing her 4yo son, WA mum navigates grief one day at a time

image.altText: Rachel Yang in a coworking space in Melbourne

props.synopsis: Data shows just 2 per cent of total capital raised in Australia in 2024 went to all-female founded teams in 2024. Some of Australia's leading entrepreneurs and investors think Australia should ignore Donald Trump and instead follow California's lead to make diversity reporting mandatory.

title.children: Trump wants to end diversity quotas. Investors say Australia needs more

image.altText: Cows in a barn being milked.

props.synopsis: An ongoing avian influenza outbreak in the US shows no signs of abating, as thousands of staff at the nation's leading health and science agencies have been let go.

title.children: Bird flu spreads in US as it grapples with worst influenza season since 2009

image.altText: A computer-generated image off a rocket blasting off in a country area.

props.synopsis: The Queensland company planning to send satellites to space from Australia says its first test rocket could launch anytime from March 15.

title.children: Australia's first space rocket could blast off in matter of weeks

image.altText: A NSW Marine Rescue boat on the water.

props.synopsis: Marine police say a missing fisherman reeled in a mako shark and then lost his footing before being dragged under water 55 kilometres off the NSW coast.

title.children: Missing Sydney fisherman pulled overboard by mako shark

image.altText: A racing greyhound highlighted mid-race.

props.synopsis: Animal welfare activists are concerned the "true breadth of racing-related deaths" in the greyhound industry are unknown.

title.children: This was Supreme Caesar's final race before it died, earning $0 for its owner

image.altText: Virat Kohli holds his bat and helmet aloft after reaching an ODI century for India

props.synopsis: Virat Kohli guides India to a six-wicket Champions Trophy victory over Pakistan in Dubai, setting a new individual record in the process.

title.children: Kohli sets new record as India beats Pakistan in Champions Trophy

image.altText: Charlotte Caslick makes a run for the Wallaroos

props.synopsis: Australia's women cop a 34-10 semifinal drubbing from top-ranked New Zealand at the Rugby SVNS tournament in Canada.

title.children: Aussies thumped by New Zealand in Vancouver sevens semifinal

image.altText: Men playing cricket on a video live feed in Traralgon

props.synopsis: Wild scenes of a brawl during a regional cricket match in Victoria's east have been broadcast online.

title.children: Headbutt, punches as live-streamed local cricket match erupts
